suffix_system.description: Optimized suffix system after comprehensive audit - only necessary suffixes are generated

last_only.description: Variables only available for completed games (results, scores)

base_next_only.description: Variables only for current and upcoming games (odds, betting lines)

base_only.description: Team identity and season stats that don't vary by game context

all_three.description: Game-specific variables that vary across contexts

none.description: Base variable from current game context

pregame_filler.description: 6 PM before Lakers game at 7 PM

notes: Suffix strategy optimized based on comprehensive audit of all 184 base variables
Only necessary suffixes are generated - reduces bloat from 552 to 443 total variables
Team identity variables (41) are BASE ONLY - same across all game contexts
Betting/odds variables (7) are BASE + .next ONLY - not relevant for completed games
Result/score variables (10) are .last ONLY - only meaningful for completed games
Game-specific variables (126) have ALL THREE contexts - vary by game
Suffixed variables gracefully disappear if context unavailable (no next/last game)
Fully backward compatible - existing templates continue working

usage_guide.how_it_works: Each variable documented in this JSON is automatically available with .next and .last suffixes (where applicable). You do NOT need separate JSON entries for suffixed variables.
usage_guide.generation: The template engine generates suffixed variables automatically by processing game contexts three times: once for current game (base), once for next game (.next), and once for last game (.last).
usage_guide.sample_data: Sample data will automatically populate for ALL suffix variations. If 'opponent' shows 'Los Angeles Lakers', then 'opponent.next' might show 'LA Clippers' and 'opponent.last' might show 'Miami Heat'.

examples.note: Result is a .last ONLY variable - only available for completed games
Odds are BASE + .next ONLY - not relevant for completed games

BASE_ONLY.description: Team identity and season stats - same across all game contexts
BASE_ONLY.rationale: These don't change based on which game you're looking at

LAST_ONLY.description: Game results and scores - only exist for completed games
LAST_ONLY.rationale: Results only exist after a game is completed

BASE_NEXT_ONLY.description: Betting odds and lines - only relevant for future games
BASE_NEXT_ONLY.rationale: Historical odds aren't useful for templates

ALL_THREE.description: Game-specific data that varies across contexts
ALL_THREE.rationale: These change for each game - opponent, date, location, etc.

template_examples.name: Pregame filler
template_examples.output: Up next: LA Clippers at Little Caesars Arena on November 23, 2025

template_examples.name: Idle filler
template_examples.template: Last game: {result.last} vs {opponent.last}. Next up: {opponent.next} on {game_date.next}
template_examples.output: Last game: win vs Miami Heat. Next up: LA Clippers on November 23, 2025

template_examples.name: Game event with context
template_examples.template: Tonight: {opponent} at {venue}. Last met on {rematch_date} ({rematch_result}). Next game: {opponent.next}
template_examples.output: Tonight: Los Angeles Lakers at Kia Center. Last met on October 28, 2025 (win). Next game: LA Clippers

important_notes: Each variable is documented ONCE in variables.json
Suffixed versions are generated AUTOMATICALLY by the code
Sample data populates for ALL applicable suffix versions
You do NOT need to add separate JSON entries for .next or .last
The suffix strategy (BASE ONLY, LAST ONLY, etc.) determines which suffixes are available
Empty values are returned gracefully if context is unavailable (e.g., no next game scheduled)

variables.name: team_name_pascal
variables.description: Team name in PascalCase for channel IDs
variables.notes: BASE_ONLY: No spaces, each word capitalized. Use with {league_id} for channel IDs like 'DetroitPistons.nhl'

variables.name: streak
variables.description: Current streak count (absolute value for display)
variables.notes: Always positive. Use for display (e.g., '14-game losing streak')

variables.name: streak_raw
variables.description: Current streak count (signed value for conditional logic)
variables.notes: Negative for losses, positive for wins. Use in conditions (e.g., loss_streak >= 10)

variables.name: home_streak
variables.description: Home win/loss streak (formatted with W/L prefix)

variables.name: away_streak
variables.description: Away win/loss streak (formatted with W/L prefix)

variables.name: final_score
variables.description: Final score (only shows if game is final, otherwise empty)
variables.notes: LAST_ONLY: Available only as {final_score.last} for completed games

variables.name: football_passing_leader_name
variables.description: Passing leader name from last completed game
variables.notes: Only available for completed games (.last suffix only). Shows top passer from the most recent game.

variables.name: football_passing_leader_stats
variables.description: Passing leader stats from last completed game
variables.notes: Only available for completed games (.last suffix only). Full stat line for passing leader.

variables.name: football_rushing_leader_name
variables.description: Rushing leader name from last completed game
variables.notes: Only available for completed games (.last suffix only). Shows top rusher from the most recent game.

variables.name: football_rushing_leader_stats
variables.description: Rushing leader stats from last completed game
variables.notes: Only available for completed games (.last suffix only). Full stat line for rushing leader.

variables.name: football_receiving_leader_name
variables.description: Receiving leader name from last completed game
variables.notes: Only available for completed games (.last suffix only). Shows top receiver from the most recent game.

variables.name: football_receiving_leader_stats
variables.description: Receiving leader stats from last completed game
variables.notes: Only available for completed games (.last suffix only). Full stat line for receiving leader.

variables.name: basketball_scoring_leader_name
variables.description: Scoring leader name from last completed game
variables.notes: Only available for completed games (.last suffix only). Shows top scorer from the most recent game. Works for NBA, WNBA, NCAAM, NCAAW.

variables.name: basketball_scoring_leader_points
variables.description: Scoring leader points from last completed game
variables.notes: Only available for completed games (.last suffix only). Points scored by the scoring leader. Works for NBA, WNBA, NCAAM, NCAAW.

variables.name: opponent_college_conference
variables.description: Opponent's conference name for college sports
variables.source: Opponent stats from ESPN API -> conference_name (college only)

variables.name: opponent_college_conference_abbrev
variables.description: Opponent's conference abbreviation for college sports
variables.source: Opponent stats from ESPN API -> conference_abbrev (college only)

variables.name: opponent_pro_conference
variables.description: Opponent's conference name for pro sports
variables.source: Opponent stats from ESPN API -> conference_name (pro only)

variables.name: opponent_pro_conference_abbrev
variables.description: Opponent's conference abbreviation for pro sports
variables.source: Opponent stats from ESPN API -> conference_abbrev (pro only)

variables.name: opponent_pro_division
variables.description: Opponent's division name for pro sports
variables.source: Opponent stats from ESPN API -> division_name
